children.text: The flooring is springy/bouncy when walked upon.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 14.07 Springy floors states that

‘Floors that bounce in a way that can be detected by a person walking normally in a trafficable area are defective if the substructure has not been constructed in accordance with the Building Code of Australia and AS 1684’ .
This floor must be rectified in accordance with above.
